job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in East Lansing, MI
pros:
- Collaborative project opportunities with many subject matter experts
- Access to many facilities, equipment and software for research and classroom work
-Many opportunities to interact with students, faculty, and staff through intermural sports and other on-campus activities
- Very extensive network of MSU alumni throughout the world
cons:
- Very large organization, which may not be palatable to some
- Listed experiences are for the college of engineering. Other colleges may be different

review_title: University Advancement team is very toxic.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Lansing, MI
pros: MSU is a great university.  Hopefully the current bad apples in charge of University Advancement and HR will turn over soon.
cons: If you aren’t in the inner circle of people who have been there 20 years, you will struggle.  Recent newspaper reports of ethics violations are true.  ExpectIng more fallout in 2019.

job_title: Student Library Assistant in East Lansing, MI
pros: The biggest Pro is the fact that when there are few patrons you can squeeze in some study time. It's not hard work. Hours are flexible and given enough notice you can be sure that someone will take your shift if you have something pressing to attend to.
cons: It gets boring. It's essentially a customer service job if you're working at the front desk like I did.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in East Lansing, MI
pros: MSU has one of the most beautiful campuses in the country. It is a wonderful place to work with great pay and benefits.
cons: Although MSU is an amazing place to work, Michigan is also a very cold state. If you enjoy the cold and cold winter sports this is the state.

review_title: Good starting point for student work building resume experience and network
job_title: Information Technologist in East Lansing, MI
pros: Generally friendly and interesting faculty and staff that are eager to share details of their research/field of study and happenings with a low ranking undergrad peon such as yourself.
cons: Not much for growth depending on the field of work. You'll be treated as non-PHD low life scum if you aren't educated as the same, standard business politics apply in this regard.

review_title: It was ok the pay was decent but I was only a tutor for a business organization
job_title: Tutor in East Lansing, MI
pros: The best thing was the autonomy I recived I basically was on my own and did my job how I wanted to
cons: The hours and times available to work was a con at my particular job

job_title: Information Technology Professional in Lansing, MI
pros: Great atmosphere, good people to be around, and always an upbeat friendly place for people to be a part of the campus culture.  I really enjoy working here.
cons: I really don't have anything negative to say about the campus. It's really enjoyable and people really seem happy to work here.

job_title: Outside Operations in East Lansing, MI
pros: Hours were very flexible, Job was easy and Fun, management was great, Free Golf, Great Coworkers, Could work as many hits as you wanted
cons: Worked early in the mornings most days of the week, Very repetitive job, When first start takes forever to get a pay check

job_title: in East Lansing, MI
pros:
Helps you learn about Diary Processing
Great people
Gets your foot into the door with other industries after graduation
Flexible hours
cons:
Work can be repetitive, monotone
Not much ability to advance to a supervisor, because it is small
Can be physically strenuous

job_title: Programmer in East Lansing, MI
pros:
Interesting work under Professors.
Learned a lot about the development process.
Working with other students as a team taught more leadership.

If anyone has the opportunity to work under a grant, I highly recommend it. It allows you to talk about things in interview and allows you to grow professionally.
cons:
Not much structure left hours and deadlines ambiguous.
Some programming is self taught, hard to grasp what was really Learned.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in East Lansing, MI
pros: Michigan State University is a great place for studying, especially for Hospitality Business, they offer a very good program in the nation.
cons: it is in a small town, east lansing  not a lot to do In the winter it is super dry and cold

review_title: Good Place to work for starting up
job_title: General Kitchen Work in East Lansing, MI
pros: flexible work schedule and everyone is really nice. you meet nice people there almost everyday, no one is really mean.
cons: very quick paced environment, you have to learn a lot of things by yourself. Thats the only bad part, and sometimes working at a venue that you have never worked before is annoying but its okay.

review_title: Non-tenure Track Faculty not valued and paid poorly
job_title: Specialist in East Lansing, MI
pros: Flexible about work schedule and very family friendly
cons: If you are non-tenure stream  faculty in a department, treated like second-class citizen and paid very poorly, even if you hold a PhD.  No career advancement for non-tenure track faculty and really very little mentoring as well: a very 'sink-or-swim' environment.

job_title: Intern in East Lansing, MI
pros: I worked at the James B. Henry Center for a little over two years and it was the best possible working experience i could have asked for. Everyone who works here is incredible and great to work with and they all helped me grow professionally.
cons: The only downfall for working here is that you inevitably have to say good bye after graduation.

review_title: Not bad for working in the Education world
job_title: Systems Analyst in East Lansing, MI
pros: A lot of freedom within the job to pick up interesting projects and make a difference within our department.
cons: A lot of time is spent building silos around departments and not sharing information and resources with others.

job_title: Linen Artisan in Lansing, MI
pros: The staff is friendly, and inviting. You can't beat the connections you make here. Company luncheons, and potlucks are the bomb!
cons: As an employee of Spartan Linen Services, working on the plant is not the most fun experience. Between the physical labor, and heat in the summer, you have to make sure you're drinking plenty of water. As well as staying physically fit.

job_title: Professor in East Lansing, MI
pros: Pleasant, if snowy, college town.
cons: Extremely cutthroat political atmosphere, easily the worst I've ever seen. If you don't have tenure, the union is lazy and toothless, completely vowed by the university President, a complete tyrant who will side against faculty.

job_title: Teaching Assistant in East Lansing, MI
pros: Good working environment and peoples are friendly. The students were friendly and easy-going and the working load was okay.
cons: The classes have expanded a lot and there are typically 70-130 students in a class. The TA has a lot more work load than before but the salary does not increase.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Lansing, MI
pros: Lansing, MI is a very cheap place to live, ideal for students. MSU is a big school and it provides lots of amenities to students, which might not be available in many other places.
cons: Winter can be extremely harsh sometimes, very difficult for those who are used to warmer places. However, will get used to it after 1 or 2 yrs.

review_title: Michigan State was a great place to start a career.
job_title: Web Developer in East Lansing, MI
pros: The best reasons to work at MSU is the Freedom, benefits, and surroundings.
cons: The only two things I found that I was not happy with was the parking situation, and communication between my college and other departments.

job_title: Student Supervisor in East Lansing, MI
pros: I enjoy working with all of the people and my employees. It is a great work environment to have during college.
cons: The only really bad thing that I see is that we start at minimum wage and it takes a long time to move up.

job_title: Level Student Supervisor for Facilities in East Lansing, MI
pros: Great Full-time staff, hard-workers, and great sense of humor
cons: some of the student staff slowly become slackers due to the fact they think it is a cushy job and that they can get away with all sorts of things.

job_title: Teaching Assistant in Lansing, MI
pros:
-It is an easy albeit time consuming job.  
-material used for class is written well for its students for my particular class.
cons:
-I feel forced to go through glassdoor because there is no safe, anonymous way to tell the instructor directly.  
-Administration doesn't communicate well at all and gets irritated when you ask them to clarify their response in email. 
- Instructor I am working with presumptuously assumed the student who gave the complaint was telling the truth.  
- Instructor asked us to do something in a very unreasonable time frame.
- Vast discrepancies between the class printed material and the rubric for this often taught class. 
- Shining example of why MSU students don't know how to work independently.
-All the boundaries on this position are set.  Instructor has an expectation of how the class should be taught, but stated we should all teach our own way day 1 which has led to problems day 100.     
-A very thankless, soul crushing, and unrewarding job.   
- I can't even phone it in because students will then complain even though doing so won't benefit them in the slightest statistically.  Then the professor will proceed to blame me for not doing what the students asked.  
-of course, most all of this is because of the professor I was assigned to. If it gets better, I'll update it.

job_title: Student Mentor
pros: Everyone was very kind and the manager was very flexible with our position.
cons: If you are on call and then work a certain number of hours you would be terminated. If you didn't work up to finals week you would be terminated. If you didn't want to work throughout the summer you were basically terminated because they were not accepting two week notices.

review_title: A decent job indoors while going taking classes
job_title: Clerical/Data Entry in East Lansing, MI
pros: Indoors but low pay for what it is. Some projects can be interesting at least. Better than retail or door to door salesman.
cons: Repetative of course, but there is time to do homework in the downtime. Overall an ok job to have while going to school full time. There are probably better student jobs in the college though.

job_title: Director in East Lansing, MI
pros: A vibrant community of scholars. Park like campus. Down to earth colleagues that care about everyday people and doing good.
cons: Unionized staff sometimes lack survival instinct in the private sector. The colleges sometimes forget they are part of university. Faculty can be sole proprietors.

review_title: Great working experience, especially for someone who is a full-time student.
job_title: Student Supervisor in East Lansing, MI
pros: If you are a student and need some extra cash, you should consider working on-campus at Michigan State University becasue they have very flexible hours and management is very easy going.
cons: I cannot describe any cons, except that the pay is minimum wage. However, that is expected when you are undertaking student employment.

review_title: Great University but annual increases are pathetic ...
job_title: in East Lansing, MI
pros: Good benefits.  Matching 402 of 10%.   Relaxed work environment.
cons: If you are in the College of Social Science and aren't a PH'D good luck getting a raise that keeps up with the cost of living. Things move at a snails pace!  If you come from the private sector it is hard to adjust to...

review_title: It's graduate school, tough, but paid for.
job_title: Graduate Assistant in East Lansing, MI
pros: Free tuition, good insurance. Getting to learn a great deal about my field of interest from experts at world class facilities.
cons: Classes are tough, but it's grad school. Time off and work load aren't consistent, but are very advisor dependent. A number of my peers have to wait a couple to several years to become research assistants.

job_title: Communications Specialist in East Lansing, MI
pros: Absolutely loved working withing higher education. Everyone has a connected vibe in the office and I felt like I could ask my co-workers for any help or anything.
cons: I sometimes felt like I wasn't doing enough or being utilized in my position effectively. Hindsight, I should've asked my director what else needed to be done when I felt like this,

job_title: in East Lansing, MI
pros: it is very convenient for students like me to work there. people in Michigan State University are nice to work with.
cons: nothing bad to work here. If I have to say a cons I would say better schedule arrangement and better website

job_title: Transitional and Cultural Aide in East Lansing, MI
pros:
The staff was very invested in my development as a student and employee.
I was given great tools to be successful after college.
Created a challenging atmosphere where hard work really paid off.
cons:
Under constant scrutiny from other students, faculty, and staff.
There are is a problem of over meeting and not enough project execution.
Program under constant threat of being cut due to funding.

review_title: Michigan State is a great university to work for with great people.
job_title: Graduate Student in East Lansing, MI
pros: All faculty at Michigan State are very supportive of student's who are working at the same time as taking classes. They are flexible with your schedule and know that school comes first.
cons: The only downside would be that the pay is relatively low for some positions that require a large time commitment.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in East Lansing, MI
pros: Nice area, department is largely collaborative and not competitive, good facilities
cons: Chemistry department is losing prestige in the community, department finances were severely mishandled previously and current employees are now paying for it

review_title: Alright place to work, finding fun people to work shifts with you makes or breaks your enjoyment
job_title: Lifeguard in East Lansing, MI
pros: Easy job, not a lot to do except work on homework.
cons: No upward mobility. You will not get a pay raise ever while working here. Facilities are old and worn out and management is underfunded. It will often be a struggle to get shifts to work at all.

review_title: Student Programmer Position Best on Campus!
job_title: Computer Assistant III in East Lansing, MI
pros:
- relaxed work environment
- learn more here than you do in school
- variety of projects to work on 
- trying to stay current with mobile technology
cons:
- low pay compared to internships
- no close parking available, currently 1 mile walk to building
- somewhat disorganized development process

job_title: Undergraduate Assistant in East Lansing, MI
pros: Pays roughly $10/hr and is very convenient to work right on campus.
cons: Bigger class sizes make it tricky to get to know students, and although diversity is a great aspect of MSU, its difficult to communicate at times.

review_title: Proud to work for a university.
job_title: Office Manager
pros: Dealing with interesting subject materials.  Working with MSUE Educators.
cons: Promotions, training, compensations, rewards are directed to MSU staff and not to support staff. Support staff undervalued by main office.

review_title: Memorable job, great for full time students
job_title: Student Team Leader in East Lansing, MI
pros: The schedules work around your class and extra curricular activities
cons: Upper management doesn't always realize how new policies and procedures effect employees and residents and it's not always in the best way.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in East Lansing, MI
pros: The life of a graduate student is self led and heavily dependent on the advisor. There is plenty of time to explore ideas and research interests as well as obtain fundamental training. Coursework is available on a number of subjects of practical interest.
cons: The life of a graduate student is not well respected and it can be extremely stressful.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in East Lansing, MI
pros: Research exposure is good, get to travel and present in academic conferences. Get to solve some  research problem from end-to-end.
cons: Work life balance is poor. Expected to work long hours during the weekdays and on weekends as well. Not paid well.

job_title: Director in East Lansing, MI
pros: Very good benefits. Relaxed working environment. The cost of living in the area is low and East Lansing and Okemos have excellent school systems.
cons: Very bureaucratic and resistant to change, maybe more so than most state universities but definitely not outside of the mainstream.  To many people who work at MSU went to MSU.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in East Lansing, MI
pros: The health insurance is excellent. The graduate employee union fights hard for grads.
cons:
The pay is the lowest among big universities in Michigan.  It has gradually crept up, but is still well behind others.

There are also limited options for non-teaching work experience, which can make your resume lop-sided.

job_title: Public Relations Specialist in East Lansing, MI
pros: AMAZING Health benefits and retirement plans. Health benefits are free for union employees
cons: Salaries are low,management is white, and no room for advancement or growth. 12 month probation. But a dept can work you for 12 months and let you go for no real reason and despite POSITIVE performance reviews.

review_title: Wonderful, I enjoy working here. The atmosphere is friendly and family-like.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Skokie, IL
pros: Lots of creativity allowed. The management is very open to new ideas. The team is great and people love working together. It is a very low stress and pleasant place to be.
cons: Only can work part time! There are very few benefits, such as insurance or vacation time.

job_title: Intern in East Lansing, MI
pros: Flexibility, good pay, fun atmosphere filled with Spartans. You get access to really cool people and places within the Spartan nation. My department (University Advancement) also paid for trips to events and meetings, which were always a blast.
cons: Office politics tend to get in the way of things getting done, but that's pretty much any work place.

review_title: Working experience as a part-time employee
job_title: Directed Study Group LEader in Lansing, MI
pros: Being primarily trained a physician, it was a good opportunity to work with medical students.  Again, being an epidemiologist, it was good to work with medical students on related topics.
cons: Due to my status, I could not get full-time opportunity.

job_title: Public Relations in East Lansing, MI
pros:
Positive team environment
Great mentoring
Leadership honestly cares about staff
Tuition reimbursement benefit
Generous overall benefit package
Lots of vacation and sick time
cons:
Openings for upward mobility limited
Cross-campus communication is challenging especially between different colleges
Difficult for management to remove toxic people who honestly need to go

job_title: Academic Specialist in East Lansing, MI
pros: MSU is an excellent university and treats their employees extremely well. MSU has family friendly policies to help their employees balance the needs of their work and their families.
cons: Any university would pay a bit lower than the private industry, however, the benefits are excellent. As employees advance within the university, the pay does increase and improve.

job_title: Guest Service Representative in East Lansing, MI
pros:
+very easy work
+willing to work around your class schedule
+opportunities to advance quickly
+for the work, entry level pay is adequate
+low employee turnover
+better than most jobs on campus
cons:
-unorganized 
-often disconnects between what management wants and what is conveyed to the employees

job_title: Research Assistant in East Lansing, MI
pros: Inclusive Environment, Calm city with good traffic except on Spartan games
cons: Very cold/snow for about 4 months of the year. Lack of sun leads to vitamin D deficiency

job_title: Operations Associate in East Lansing, MI
pros: Great opportunities for education, awesome coworkers, and great supervisors. Being part of the university they are very flexible when it comes to scheduling around classes and activities.
cons: Can't really think of any cons to the company. There are many ways of improving things within if you just offer ideas up to your supervisors.

review_title: Good research, not an ideal environment
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in East Lansing, MI
pros:
Beautiful campus
World class university
Some truly exceptional programs
cons:
Campus is poorly laid out, for example the Engineering Research Complex is incredibly remote from all services and other facilities
Support staff often treat supporting students as a burden rather than a part of their job

review_title: It was hard work but good
job_title: Student Supervisor in East Lansing, MI
pros: Working within South Neighborhood Dining, I learned a lot as a student and met many people. The hours were somewhat flexible and it was easy to change shifts with so many students.
cons: It was hard work at times when students would call in or just not show up.

job_title: Equity Research Analyst in East Lansing, MI
pros: Great working environment, really nice for people to build connection and study for new content related to valuation and portfolio management
cons: The working period is incorporated with class, meaning finishing the class would end the working period. Hope to work longer in MSUSIF.

job_title: Learning Assistant in East Lansing, MI
pros: Extremely flexible schedule, you are essentially your own boss. Great environment to work in, every one is friendly. The athletes are usually pretty easy going and easy to get along with and work with.
cons: Never know how many hours you will receive for the semester. Athletes can no show (but you will still get paid)

job_title: Anonymous Employee in East Lansing, MI
pros:
-Perfect on campus job.
-Opportunities to make connections with students & faculty.
-Down time enables you to study while on the job .
cons:
-Occasionally you would be asked to perform a task that you are not qualified for. 
-There are some ways that tasks can be completed more efficiently, however management does not approve of these new methods.

job_title: Sales Floor Associate in East Lansing, MI
pros: Co-workers are [generally] pleasant to be around. Free lunch/dinner on game days.
cons: Cannot go to any home football games; never scheduled during the school year; always scheduled during finals week; bosses who don't acknowledge good work but notice when you're leaning on the counter after a long shift at the end of the day.

review_title: I like to work at Michigan State University
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in East Lansing, MI
pros: Graduate research assistants at Michigan State University are provided with good healthcare plan and appropriate amount of stipend for living. Every semester, 9 credits for classes are covered by either the department or PI's funding.
cons: None for me. Maybe one downtime could be severe cold weather in winter.

review_title: Not a bad place to be for a while
job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in East Lansing, MI
pros: Great benefits for employees, campus commitment to diversity and growth.
cons: Lansing: a nice and affordable community that sometimes feels a bit lackluster.  The administration is sometimes disorganized, but mistakes, missing reimbursements, etc. usually get taken care of *eventually* (=no better or worse than your average big university).

review_title: MSU offers good benefits and job security, but little else.
job_title: Information Technologist II in East Lansing, MI
pros: Job security, benefits, environment, good people to work with.
cons: low salary, too many folks that aren't motivated to do their job.  Unions that protect the workers that aren't doing well while holding back strong performers.

review_title: Good way to get initial experience
job_title: Student Supervisor in East Lansing, MI
pros: Clear advancement structure, Work with your class schedule, you can become good friends with co-workers
cons: Student supervisors that take themselves too seriously, Full-time Middle-management that treat you as expendable fodder, no overtime/strict hours kept, not forgiving with incidental absences or tardiness

job_title: Sparty's in East Lansing, MI
pros:
Work around class schedule
Co-Workers are amazing people
Schedules change after every semester
Not required to work during school breaks
Plenty of hours
cons:
Very hard to advance
There is favoritism as you climb the corporate ladder

job_title: Research Assistant in East Lansing, MI

Not enough resources and poor student support.

Not enough food choices and activities.
Email response is slow.

review_title: Great opportunity for student advancement, but also great room for petty "politics"
job_title: in East Lansing, MI

Opportunity for advancement
Management experience
Working alongside peers
Flexible hours
Easy to get shifts picked up
Great support staff
Great way to get to know the university
cons:
Students managing students - room for bias

Early morning and late night hours

job_title: Communications Coordinator in East Lansing, MI

review_title: Great place to get started while a student

job_title: Student Graphic Designer in East Lansing, MI

I was a student employee for the Information Services of Michigan State University.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in East Lansing, MI

collaborative environment
Faculty is helpful

review_title: Fun and exciting place to work

review_title: Nice place to work at, Professors care about student assistants.
job_title: Research Assistant in East Lansing, MI

Scope for growth if you are an RA.

cons:
Unrealistic goal expectation.
RA does 98% of the grant writing  but good work experience

review_title: Brought a lot; Got a little.

job_title: Visiting Instructor/Assistant Professor in East Lansing, MI

job_title: Plant Biologist in East Lansing, MI

Is one of the most prestigious place in the world in Agricultural Research.

cons:
Plan breeding to disease Resistant
Plant Pathology to control diseases
Plant Biotechnology to fortified food

job_title: Anonymous Employee in East Lansing, MI
pros: great working environment, on a beautiful campus, in great buildings. Building heads are easy to get along with.
cons: People are gross and messy. The sooner you get over this, the better it will be.

job_title: Research Assistant in East Lansing, MI
pros:
Flexible hours during the semester
Friendly and helpful staff

job_title: Laboratory Assistant in East Lansing, MI

job_title: Business Student in East Lansing, MI

review_title: Student worker who never wants to leave
job_title: Anonymous Employee in East Lansing, MI

review_title: Good place to work with growth opportunities

No-micromanagement

review_title: Michigan State University Cares About Employees
job_title: Research Assistant in East Lansing, MI

review_title: I really enjoy working at MSU

review_title: A really good place to work and learn

review_title: A great job for a college student

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in East Lansing, MI

review_title: Excellent university with a collaborative and positive environment.

review_title: I was a student employee at MSU Greenline, and the job prepared me for the outside world better than I hoped for.

job_title: Research Professor in East Lansing, MI
